parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system, specifically the ignition switch, can cause the engine to shut down suddenly, leading to a loss of control and increasing the risk of accidents.
symptoms: overheating of electrical connectors in the wiring harness

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The difficulty in shifting into 1st gear when stopped can lead to accidents, especially on steep hills, and create an unsafe situation for the rider.
symptoms: The motorcycle will not shift into 1st gear when stopped unless rocked back and forth
the motorcycle will only shift into neutral but not 1st gear when stopped.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of all four motor mounts can cause the motor to fall out, leading to a loss of control, accidents, and injuries.
symptoms: The motor mounts break away from the frame
causing the chain to come off the sprocket

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The loss of rear brake pressure can lead to a significant reduction in braking power, increasing the risk of accidents and injuries.
symptoms: The rear brake pedal feels mushy
pumping the brake pedal repeatedly may engage the brake slightly
the brake system requires frequent flushing to restore braking capabilities.
